Wisdom: الْكَيِّسُ أَصْلُهُ عَقْلُهُ وَمُرُوءَتُهُ خُلُقُهُ وَدِينُهُ حَسَبُهُ
enWisdom: The foundation of a sagacious person is his intellect, his magnanimity is his character and his religion is his distinction

Wisdom: الْكَيِّسُ مَنْ كَانَ يَوْمُهُ خَيْراً مِنْ أَمْسِهِ وَعَقَلَ الذَّمَّ عَنْ نَفْسِهِ
enWisdom: The sagacious person is one whose today is better than his yesterday and [one who] keeps blame away from himself [by not doing anything blameworthy]

Wisdom: الْكَيِّسُ مَنْ أَحْيَا فَضَائِلَهُ وَأَمَاتَ رَذَائِلَهُ بِقَمْعِهِ شَهْوَتَهُ وَهَوَاهُ
enWisdom: The sagacious person is one who enlivens his virtues and kills off his vices by subduing his lust and his vain desires

Wisdom: الْكَيْسُ تَقْوَى اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ وَتَجَنُّبُ الْمَحَارِمِ وَإِصْلَاحُ الْمَعَادِ
enWisdom: Sagacity is [in] fearing Allah, the Glorified, eschewing the forbidden and improving one’s Hereafter [through good deeds]

Wisdom: الْكَيِّسُ مَنْ كَانَ غَافِلًا عَنْ غَيْرِهِ وَلِنَفْسِهِ كثيرا [كَثِيرَ التَّقَاضِي
enWisdom: The sagacious person is one who is inattentive towards others while expecting much from [and constantly judging] himself
The sagacious person is one who controls the reins of his lustful desires

Wisdom: الْكَيِّسُ مَنْ تَجَلْبَبَ الْحَيَاءَ وَادَّرَعَ الْحِلْمَ
enWisdom: The sagacious person is one who dons the garment of modesty and the armour of forbearance
The most honourable of believers is the most sagacious of them
The most sagacious person is one who rejects [the pleasures of] his worldly life

Wisdom: أَكْيَسُ الْأَكْيَاسِ مَنْ مَقَتَ دُنْيَاهُ وَقَطَعَ مِنْهَا أَمَلَهُ وَمُنَاهُ وَصَرَفَ عَنْهَا طَمَعَهُ وَرَجَاهُ
enWisdom: The most sagacious person of all is one who loathes this world, cuts off his hope and aspiration from it, and turns his desire and expectation away from it

Wisdom: إِنَّ الْأَكْيَاسَ هُمُ الَّذِينَ لِلدُّنْيَا مَقَتُوا وَأَعْيُنَهُمْ عَنْ [فِي‏] زَهْرَتِهَا أَغْمَضُوا وَقُلُوبَهُمْ عَنْهَا صَرَفُوا وَبِالدَّارِ الْبَاقِيَةِ تَوَلَّهُوا
enWisdom: Verily the sagacious people are those who have loathing for this world and lower their eyes from its splendour; they turn their hearts away from it and yearn passionately for the everlasting abode

Wisdom: إِنَّ الْكَيِّسَ مَنْ كَانَ لِشَهْوَتِهِ مَانِعاً وَلِنَزْوَتِهِ عِنْدَ الْحَفِيظَةِ وَاقِماً قَامِعاً
enWisdom: Verily the sagacious person is one who restrains his lustful desire and subdues his outburst in times of anger by quelling it

Wisdom: إِنَّمَا الْكَيِّسُ مَنْ إِذَا أَسَاءَ اسْتَغْفَرَ وَإِذَا أَذْنَبَ نَدِمَ
enWisdom: Only he is sagacious who seeks forgiveness when he does wrong and regrets when he commits a sin
The bane of cleverness is scheming
